etymology.interpretation: Water component flags a liquid substance, while the phonetic 昜 historically guides the pronunciation and evokes rising heat or brightness. Together they point to hot water or broth, matching the sense of soup.
etymology.simplification: Right-side phonetic 昜 was abbreviated to 𠃓 in the simplified form 汤, reducing strokes while retaining the water semantic on the left; this follows a broader series of 昜-based simplifications (e.g., 揚→扬).

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝热汤(我喜歡喝熱湯)。
examples.english: I like to drink hot soup.

examples.chinese: 这碗鸡汤很鲜(這碗雞湯很鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wǎn jī tāng hěn xiān.
examples.english: This bowl of chicken soup is very tasty.

examples.chinese: 他点了一份酸辣汤(他點了一份酸辣湯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā diǎnle yí fèn suān là tāng.
examples.english: He ordered a serving of hot-and-sour soup.
